alert.note: Alert for Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 6:51AM EST until February 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the Tuckasegee River At Bryson City affecting Swain County... ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...Tuckasegee River At Bryson City. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, River overflows its banks and begin to move into the Bear Hunter Campground near Bryson City. At 10.0 feet, Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the river will flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will remain flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest around 10.5 feet this morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this afternoon before 1200 PM EST.
